commands.name: Scroll up
commands.notes: Scrolls the picture up, both in magnify and normal mode. This hotkey cannot be removed.

commands.name: Scroll down
commands.notes: Scrolls the picture down, both in magnify and normal mode. This hotkey cannot be removed.

commands.name: Scroll left
commands.notes: Scrolls the picture to the left, both in magnify and normal mode. This hotkey cannot be removed.

commands.name: Scroll right
commands.notes: Scrolls the picture to the right, both in magnify and normal mode. This hotkey cannot be removed.

commands.name: Faster scroll up
commands.notes: Used to scroll upwards in the picture fast, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Faster scroll down
commands.notes: Used to scroll downwards in the picture fast, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Faster scroll left
commands.notes: Used to scroll to the left in the picture fast, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Faster scroll right
commands.notes: Used to scroll to the right in the picture fast, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Slower scroll up
commands.notes: Used to scroll upwards in the picture pixel by pixel, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Slower scroll down
commands.notes: Used to scroll downwards in the picture pixel by pixel, either in magnify andnormal mode. normal mode.

commands.name: Slower scroll left
commands.notes: Used to scroll to the left in the picture pixel by pixel, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Slower scroll right
commands.notes: Used to scroll to the right in the picture pixel by pixel, either in magnify and normal mode.

commands.name: Move mouse cursor 1 pixel up
commands.notes: Used to simulate a very small mouse deplacement upwards. Its very useful when you want a ultra-high precision.

commands.name: Move mouse cursor 1 pixel down
commands.notes: Used to simulate a very small mouse deplacement downwards. Its very useful when you want a ultra-high precision.

commands.name: Move mouse cursor 1 pixel left
commands.notes: Used to simulate a very small mouse deplacement to the left. Its very useful when you want a ultra-high precision.

commands.name: Move mouse cursor 1 pixel right
commands.notes: Used to simulate a very small mouse deplacement to the right. Its very useful when you want a ultra-high precision.

commands.name: Simulate left mouse click
commands.notes: Used to simulate a click with the left mouse button.. Its very useful when you want a ultra-high precision.

commands.name: Simulate right mouse click
commands.notes: Used to simulate a click with the right mouse button.. Its very useful when you want a ultra-high precision.

commands.name: Settings
commands.notes: Opens a menu which permits you to set the dimension of your picture, and to modify some parameters of the program.

commands.name: Screen resolution menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can choose the dimensions of the screen in which you want to draw among the numerous X and SVGA proposed modes.

commands.name: "Safety" resolution
commands.notes: Set resolution to 320x200. This can be useful if you choosed a resolution that is not supported by your monitor and video card. Cannot be removed.

commands.name: Show/hide option menu
commands.notes: Switch the tool bar display on/off. This hot-key cannot be removed.

commands.name: Show/hide cursor
commands.notes: Switch the cursor display on/off. This only works on the "small cross" and "hand" cursors.

commands.name: Set paintbrush to 1 pixel
commands.notes: Useful when you want to use a "single-pixel-brush".

commands.name: Paintbrush choice
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can choose a paintbrush out of 24 predefined ones.

commands.name: Monochrome brush
commands.notes: Turn your current user-defined brush into a single colored one. All non-transparent colors are set to current foreground color.

commands.name: Undo (Oops!)
commands.notes: Cancel the last action which modified the picture. This has no effect after a jump to the spare page, loading a picture or modifying its size.

commands.name: Redo
commands.notes: Redo the last undone action. This has no effect after a jump to the spare page, loading a picture or modifying its size.

commands.name: Freehand drawing
commands.notes: Set the drawing mode to the classical freehand one.

commands.name: Switch freehand drawing mode
commands.notes: Switch between the 3 ways to use freehand drawing. These modes are: continuous, discontinuous and point by point.

commands.name: Continuous freehand drawing
commands.notes: Switch directly to continuous freehand drawing mode.

commands.name: Line
commands.notes: Allows you to draw lines.

commands.name: Knotted lines
commands.notes: Allows you to draw linked lines. This mode can also be called "Polyline".

commands.name: Spray
commands.notes: Allows you to spray brushes randomly in the picture.

commands.name: Spray menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu in which you can configure the spray flow and size.

commands.name: Flood-fill
commands.notes: Allows you to fill an area of the picture made of pixels of the same color.

commands.name: Replace color
commands.notes: Allows you to replace all the pixels of the color pointed by the mouse with the fore-color or the back-color.

commands.name: Beziers curves
commands.notes: Allows you to draw Beziers curves.

commands.name: Beziers curve with 3 or 4 points
commands.notes: Allows you to choose whether you want to draw Beziers curves with 3 or 4 points.

commands.name: Empty rectangle
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a rectangle using the brush.

commands.name: Filled rectangle
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a filled rectangle.

commands.name: Empty circle
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a circle using the brush.

commands.name: Empty ellipse
commands.notes: Allows you to draw an ellipse using the brush.

commands.name: Filled circle
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a filled circle.

commands.name: Filled ellipse
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a filled ellipse.

commands.name: Empty polygon
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a polygon using the brush.

commands.name: Empty "polyform"
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a freehand polygon using the brush.

commands.name: Filled polygon
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a filled polygon.

commands.name: Filled "polyform"
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a filled freehand polygon.

commands.name: Rectangle with gradation
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a rectangle with a color gradation.

commands.name: Gradation menu
commands.notes: Allows you to configure the way color gradations are calculated.

commands.name: Sphere with gradation
commands.notes: Allows you to draw a rectangle with a color gradation.

commands.name: Ellipse with gradation
commands.notes: Allows you to draw an ellipse filled with a color gradation.

commands.name: Text
commands.notes: Opens a menu which permits you to type in a character string and to choose a font, and then creates a new user-defined brush fitting to your choices.

commands.name: Shrink paintbrush
commands.notes: Decrease the width of the paintbrush if it is special circle or square.

commands.name: Enlarge paintbrush
commands.notes: Increase the width of the paintbrush if it is special circle or square.

commands.name: Adjust picture
commands.notes: Allows you to move the whole picture in order to re-center it. Notice that what gets out from a side reappears on the other.

commands.name: Flip/shrink picture menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu which allows you to flip the picture horizontally/vertically or to shrink it to half-scale horizontally and/or vertically.

commands.name: Drawing effects
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can enable/disable and configure the drawing effects listed below.

commands.name: Shade mode
commands.notes: Allows you to shade or lighten some pixels of the picture belonging to a color range, in addition of any drawing tool.

commands.name: Shade menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can choose color ranges to use with the Shade mode. This menu also contains parameters used both in Shade and Quick-shade modes.

commands.name: Quick-shade mode
commands.notes: Does the same thing as shade mode with a simpler method (faster to define but a bit less powerful).

commands.name: Quick-shade menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can define the parameters of the quick-shade mode.

commands.name: Stencil mode
commands.notes: Allows you to mask colors that must not be affected when you are drawing.

commands.name: Stencil menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can choose colors masked by the Stencil mode.

commands.name: Mask mode
commands.notes: Allows you to mask colors of the spare page that will keep you from drawing. This mode should be called "True stencil".

commands.name: Mask menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can choose colors for the Mask mode.

commands.name: Grid mode
commands.notes: Force the cursor to snap up grid points.

commands.name: Grid menu
commands.notes: Open a menu where you can configure the grid used by Grid mode.

commands.name: Sieve mode
commands.notes: Only draws pixels on certain positions matching with a sieve.

commands.name: Sieve menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can configure the sieve.

commands.name: Invert sieve
commands.notes: Inverts the pattern defined in the Sieve menu.

commands.name: Colorize mode
commands.notes: Allows you to colorize the pixels on which your brush is pasted. This permits you to make transparency effects.

commands.name: Colorize menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can give the opacity percentage for Colorize mode.

commands.name: Smooth mode
commands.notes: Soften pixels on which your brush is pasted.

commands.name: Smooth menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can define the Smooth matrix.

commands.name: Smear mode
commands.notes: Smears the pixels when you move your brush on the picture.

commands.name: Tiling mode
commands.notes: Puts parts of the brush where you draw.

commands.name: Tiling menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can configure the origin of the tiling.

commands.name: Classical brush grabbing
commands.notes: Allows you to pick a brush defined within a rectangle.

commands.name: "Lasso" brush grabbing
commands.notes: Allows you to pick a brush defined within a freehand polygon.

commands.name: Get previous brush back
commands.notes: Restore the last user-defined brush.

commands.name: Horizontal brush flipping
commands.notes: Reverse brush horizontally.

commands.name: Vertical brush flipping
commands.notes: Reverse brush vertically.

commands.name: 90ø brush rotation
commands.notes: Rotate the user-defined brush by 90ø (counter-clockwise).

commands.name: 180ø brush rotation
commands.notes: Rotate the user-defined brush by 180ø.

commands.name: Strech brush
commands.notes: Allows you to resize the user-defined brush.

commands.name: Distort brush
commands.notes: Allows you to distort the user-defined brush.

commands.name: Outline brush
commands.notes: Outlines the user-defined brush with the fore color.

commands.name: Nibble brush
commands.notes: Deletes the borders of the user-defined brush. This does the opposite of the Outline option.

commands.name: Get colors from brush
commands.notes: Copy colors of the spare page that are used in the brush.

commands.name: Recolorize brush
commands.notes: Recolorize pixels of the user-defined brush in order to get a brush which looks like the one grabbed in the spare page.

commands.name: Rotate by any angle
commands.notes: Rotate the brush by an angle that you can define.

commands.name: Brush effects menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu which proposes different effects on the user-defined brush.

commands.name: Center brush attachment point
commands.notes: Set the attachement of the user-defined brush to its center.

commands.name: Top-left brush attachment point
commands.notes: Set the attachement of the user-defined brush to its top-left corner.

commands.name: Top-right brush attachment point
commands.notes: Set the attachement of the user-defined brush to its top-right corner.

commands.name: Bottom-left brush attachment point
commands.notes: Set the attachement of the user-defined brush to its bottom-left corner.

commands.name: Bottom-right brush attachment point
commands.notes: Set the attachement of the user-defined brush to its bottom-right corner.

commands.name: Pipette
commands.notes: Allows you to copy the color of a pixel in the picture into the foreground or background color.

commands.name: Swap foreground/background colors
commands.notes: Invert foreground and background colors.

commands.name: Palette menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu which allows you to modify the current palette.

commands.name: Secondary palette menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu which allows you to define color series and some tagged colors.

commands.name: Exclude colors menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu which allows you to define the colors you dont want to use in modes such as Smooth and Transparency, or when remapping a brush.

commands.name: Scroll palette to the left
commands.notes: Scroll palette in the tool bar to the left, column by column.

commands.name: Scroll palette to the right
commands.notes: Scroll palette in the tool bar to the right, column by column.

commands.name: Scroll palette to the left faster
commands.notes: Scroll palette in the tool bar to the left, 8 columns by 8 columns.

commands.name: Scroll palette to the right faster
commands.notes: Scroll palette in the tool bar to the right, 8 columns by 8 columns.

commands.name: Next foreground color
commands.notes: Set the foreground color to the next in the palette.

commands.name: Previous foreground color
commands.notes: Set the foreground color to the previous in the palette.

commands.name: Next background color
commands.notes: Set the background color to the next in the palette.

commands.name: Previous background color
commands.notes: Set the background color to the previous in the palette.

commands.name: Next user-defined forecolor
commands.notes: Set the foreground color to the next in the user-defined color series.

commands.name: Previous user-defined forecolor
commands.notes: Set the foreground color to the previous in the user-defined color series.

commands.name: Next user-defined backcolor
commands.notes: Set the background color to the next in the user-defined color series.

commands.name: Previous user-defined backcolor
commands.notes: Set the background color to the previous in the user-defined color series.

commands.name: Magnifier mode
commands.notes: Allows you to zoom into the picture.

commands.name: Zoom factor menu
commands.notes: Opens a menu where you can choose a magnifying factor.

commands.name: Zoom in
commands.notes: Increase magnifying factor.

commands.name: Zoom out
commands.notes: Decrease magnifying factor.

commands.name: Quit program
commands.notes: Allows you to leave the program. If modifications were not saved, confirmation is asked.

commands.name: Help and credits
commands.notes: Opens a window where you can get information about the program.

commands.name: Statistics
commands.notes: Displays miscellaneous more or less useful information.

commands.name: Save picture as...
commands.notes: Opens a file-selector that allows you to save your picture with a new path-name.

commands.name: Save picture
commands.notes: Saves your picture with the last name you gave it.

commands.name: Load picture
commands.notes: Opens a file-selector that allows you to load a new picture.

commands.name: Re-load picture
commands.notes: Re-load the current picture. This allows you to cancel modifications made since last saving.

commands.name: Save brush
commands.notes: Opens a file-selector that allows you to save your current user-defined brush.

commands.name: Load brush
commands.notes: Opens a file-selector that allows you to load a brush.

commands.name: Jump to spare page
commands.notes: Swap current page and spare page.

commands.name: Copy current page to spare page
commands.notes: Copy current page to spare page.

commands.name: Kill
commands.notes: Kills the current page. It actually removes the current page from the list of "Undo" pages.

commands.name: Clear page
commands.notes: Clears the picture with the first color of the palette (usually black).

commands.name: Clear page with backcolor
commands.notes: Clears the picture with the backcolor.
